title: 115_s1199
content: The Act may be cited as the "Border Enforcement Security Task Force Reauthorization Act of 2017" and includes modified instructions. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include updated considerations for the establishment of units, such as applying risk-based criteria and assessing threats posed by transnational criminal organizations. Additionally, the amendment includes evaluating the extent to which the BEST unit would advance the Department's homeland and border security strategic priorities and objectives. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include updated considerations for the establishment of Port Security BEST units, composed of specific members for enhanced port security operations. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to require the Secretary to submit an annual report to Congress on the effectiveness of BEST in enhancing border security and combating various criminal activities along the international borders of the United States. The annual report to Congress on the effectiveness of BEST includes assessments on information-sharing, capability gaps, strategic priorities, joint operational efforts, additional authorities needed, and the need for additional Memos of Understanding to address intelligence and coordination gaps, as well as an assessment of the impact of funding on the overall mission of BEST operations. SEC. 3. AUTHORIZATION OF DANGER PAY ALLOWANCE FOR ICE AGENTS STATIONED IN DANGEROUS AREAS. Sense of Congress is to provide danger pay to ICE agents in dangerous overseas posts to modernize compensation system and align ICE with DOJ agencies. Authorization is given for danger pay allowance for DEA, FBI, and ICE employees. Conforming amendment to Foreign Relations Authorization Act. The Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1990 and 1991 (Public Law 101-246) is repealed. The Director of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement must report to specific committees on overseas posts designated for ICE agents to receive danger pay allowance and provide justification for each designation.
